meanings.definition: To treat with disrespect or contempt.
meanings.sent1: She slightingly dismissed his ideas during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: He always slightingly mocks his classmates behind their backs.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked at the dog slightingly, as if saying, 'You are beneath me.'
meanings.sent4: Her tone was slightingly sharp, cutting through his confidence.
meanings.sent5: The bully's words hit him slightingly, leaving a mark on his self-esteem.

meanings.definition: In a manner that shows a lack of seriousness or importance.
meanings.sent1: She spoke slightingly of the new policy changes at work.
meanings.sent2: He shrugged slightingly when asked about his upcoming presentation.
meanings.sent3: The comedian delivered his jokes slightingly, making the audience chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The old house stood slightingly on the hill, forgotten by time.
meanings.sent5: The teacher glanced slightingly at the messy homework, sighing in disappointment.
